> [pycole](#comment_9_1KwTTgPRSTHFmmJAFBt6kQfdyNeSM5KJuH): If we one day find this theory to be true, we'll probably try to ascend/travel to the higher reality (exploration is awesome, no?). The problem is that we'll have to ask ourselves the big question: is this the highest level?...And then we find that it isn't, travel to the next one, repeat ad infinitum. Since each universe must be more advanced than the one it simulates, we will have an increasingly harder time comprehending our surroundings. In addition, detecting cosmic aberrations will become more challenging--along with determining ways to travel upwards.I hope that answers something for you--or raises even more interesting questions.
